feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA1/SGP1][Dedicated Servers] - Network equipment version upgrade
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 29, 21:00 UTC  -  Nov 30, 00:00 UTC

Aug 24, 17:44 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 29/11/2023 21:00 UTC
End time : 30/11/2023 00:00 UTC

Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a version upgrade on multiple network equipment.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - End of Life Real Time Monitoring APIv6
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 7, 09:30 - 10:00 UTC

Sep 22, 11:30 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/11/2023 09:30 UTC
End time : 07/11/2023 10:00 UTC
Service impact : The End of Life of Real Time Monitoring (RTM) for baremetal is scheduled for the 7th of November 2023.
Few customers will be impacted (less than 10) and will stop be able to monitor their dedicated servers via the APIv6. This will impact APIv6 calls /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/statistics.

R804L23 - R804L02 - R803R22 - R803R20 -R803R19 - R803R15 -R803R14 - R803R13 - R803L22 - R803L20 - R803L19 - R803L18 - R803L17 - R803L16 - R803L15 - R803L14 - R802R24 - R802R23 - R802R22 - R802R18 -R802R17 - R802L23

entry.title: [RBX8][Dedicated Servers] - R833B11
entry.content:
Oct 26, 19:21 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 26/10/2023 18:49 UTC
End time : 26/10/2023 19:18 UTC
Root cause : Incident caused by a software problem (kernel panic)
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Oct 26, 19:05 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 26/10/2023 18:49 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rack R833B11 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [BHS][Dedicated Servers] - Network Perturbation Incident Notification
entry.content:
Oct 26, 13:29 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 21/10/2023 09:14 UTC
End time : 21/10/2023 14:24 UTC
Root cause : Post-Mortem will be published after incident closing
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Oct 21, 15:23 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented by our technical teams to fix the network perturbations.
Since 14:24 UTC no more network perturbations present.
Our teams are monitoring the situation

Oct 21, 14:00 UTC
Update - Our teams are still working on fixing the issue.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Oct 21, 10:19 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 21/10/2023 09:14 UTC
Service impact : We are experiencing some degradation on servers in BHS.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [EU][Dedicated Servers] - Reboot issue
entry.content:
Oct 26, 13:11 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 26/10/2023 10:22 UTC
End time : 26/10/2023 12:15 UTC
Service Impacted : Most of our Baremetal servers have experienced problems with disk boot or rescue.
- UEFI machines: could not reboot either to disk or to rescue
- Legacy BIOS machines: could not reboot to rescue-customer
Root cause : The incident is due to a misconfiguration in our IPLB infrastructure.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Dedicated Servers] - Delivery certificate
entry.content:
Oct 25, 15:20 UTC
Monitoring - Update : A fix has been deployed, we are monitoring the ticket to confirm the resolution.

Oct 25, 12:57 UTC
Identified - Start time : 23/10/2023 00:00 UTC
Service impact : The certificate of conformity for deliveries of Baremetal servers (except SYS and KS servers) is no longer issued automatically.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are working to resolve the problem. Certificates will be added as soon as possible.
Workaround : However, you can request your certificate from the support teams.

entry.title: [RBX1][Dedicated Servers] - Rack 09B09
entry.content:
Oct 25, 00:46 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 15/10/2023 03:00 UTC
End time : 15/10/2023 03:10 UTC
Service impact : A flap was observed on public network of servers in rack 09B09
Root cause : A network equipment caused the incident
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Oct 19, 18:22 UTC
Update - Update : You can follow the maintenance on this ticket.
Related maintenance : https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/bb1t8rm8gq05

Oct 19, 13:16 UTC
Update - Update : Maintenance will be scheduled for the night of 24 to 25 October to resolve the incident definitively.

Oct 15, 03:57 UTC
Monitoring - Service impact : Since 03:10 UTC no more flap is being observed on public network of servers in rack 09B09
Root cause : A network equipment caused the incident
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently monitoring the situation

Oct 15, 03:25 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 15/10/2023 03:00 UTC
Service impact : A flap is being observed on public network of servers in rack 09B09
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [RBX1][Dedicated Servers] - 09B09
entry.content:

Oct 24, 22:02 UTC

End time : 25/10/2023 04:00 UTC
